title: Workflow-based evaluation of Music Generation Systems
author: Shayan Dadman (Department of Computer Science, UiT), Bernt Arild Bremdal (Department of Computer Science, UiT), Andreas Bergsland (Department of Music, NTNU), ...
relevance_why: This paper evaluates Music Generation Systems (MGS) which are highly relevant to my work on generative audio models, particularly in understanding how these systems improve collaborative workflows in music production.
background: This study assesses various Music Generation Systems by examining their technical traits and practical applications within contemporary music production workflows.
contribution: The paper introduces a mixed-method evaluation framework to analyze Music Generation Systems (MGS) and their capabilities, identifying both their limitations and strengths in creative contexts.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previously, evaluations of music generation focused either on purely technical capabilities or on subjective user experiences without a systematic approach.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines qualitative and quantitative assessments, providing a more comprehensive understanding of MGS within real-world music production workflows.

key_innovation: Develops an evaluation framework that integrates theoretical and practical aspects of music generation, making it adaptable to various production contexts.
real_world_impact: This research provides empirical insights that can guide future developments in AI music tools, improving capabilities and user experience in creative workflows.
limitations: No explicit limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Music Generation Systems (MGS): **Music Generation Systems (MGS)** are AI tools designed to assist in various aspects of music creation, including composition and sound design.
